faq.trial_q: How does the free trial work?
faq.trial_a: Sign up and get 30 days of full access to our platform with no credit card required. After the trial, you can choose to subscribe at competitive local pricing or cancel anytime.
faq.cancel_a: Yes! You can cancel your subscription at any time. There are no long-term contracts or cancellation fees.
faq.payment_q: What payment methods do you accept?
faq.payment_a: We accept all major payment methods through Paystack, including cards, bank transfers, and mobile money.
faq.candidates_q: How many candidates can I contact?
faq.candidates_a: With a Premium subscription, you have unlimited access to search and contact candidates. There are no limits on the number of searches or assessments you can create.
faq.refunds_a: We don't offer refunds for partial months, but you can cancel at any time to avoid future charges. Try our 30-day free trial to ensure Jorbex is right for you.

overview.content: Employment law in Africa varies by country but shares common principles rooted in international labor standards, constitutional rights, and local legislation. This guide provides key information for employers and employees operating across the continent.

employment_law.note: Note: This page contains detailed legal information specific to each country. The content below is provided in English for reference. For legal matters, please consult with a qualified employment lawyer in your jurisdiction.

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.content: Jorbex ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our platform.

section2.title: 2. Information We Collect
candidates: Personal information (name, email, phone number, location)

section3.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
section3.intro: We use the collected information for:
items: Improving our platform and user experience

section4.title: 4. Information Sharing
section4.intro: We share your information only in the following circumstances:
section4.employers_desc: Candidate profiles are visible to subscribed employers
section4.legal_desc: When required by law or to protect our rights
section4.business_desc: In case of merger, acquisition, or sale of assets
section4.no_sell: We do NOT sell your personal information to third parties.

section5.title: 5. Data Security
section5.intro: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your information:
items: Encryption of data in transit and at rest

section6.title: 6. Your Rights
section6.intro: Under Nigerian Data Protection Regulation (NDPR) and other applicable laws, you have the right to:
items: Object to processing of your data

section7.title: 7. Data Retention
section7.content: We retain your information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide services. After account deletion, we may retain certain information for legal compliance, dispute resolution, and fraud prevention purposes.

section8.title: 8. Cookies
section8.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience, analyze usage, and provide personalized content. You can control cookies through your browser settings.

section9.title: 9. Children's Privacy
section9.content: Our services are not intended for individuals under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children.

section10.title: 10. International Data Transfers
section10.content: Your information may be transferred to and processed in countries outside Nigeria. We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place to protect your data in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

section11.title: 11. Changes to This Policy
section11.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date.
